verses.verse: Then Eliphaz <WH464> the Temanite <WH8489> answered, <WH6030>
"If someone ventures <WH5254> to talk <WH1697> with you, <WH3811> will you be grieved? But who can <WH3201> withhold <WH6113> himself from speaking? <WH4405>
Behold, <WH3256> you have instructed many, <WH7227> you have strengthened <WH2388> the weak <WH7504> hands. <WH3027>
Your words <WH4405> have supported <WH6965> him who was falling, <WH3782> You have made firm <WH553> the feeble <WH3766> knees. <WH1290>
But now it has come <WH935> to you, <WH3811> and you faint. It touches <WH5060> you, <WH926> and you are troubled.
Isn't <WH3374> your piety your confidence? <WH3690> Isn't <WH8537> the integrity of your ways <WH1870> your hope? <WH8615>
"Remember, <WH2142> now, <WH6> whoever perished, being innocent? <WH5355> Or where <WH375> were the upright <WH3477> cut off? <WH3582>
According to what I have seen, <WH7200> those who plow <WH2790> iniquity, <WH205> and sow <WH2232> trouble, <WH5999> reap the same. <WH7114>
By the breath <WH5397> of God <WH433> they perish. <WH6> By the blast <WH7307> of his anger <WH639> are they consumed. <WH3615>
The roaring <WH7581> of the lion, <WH738> and the voice <WH6963> of the fierce lion, <WH7826> the teeth <WH8127> of the young lions, <WH3715> are broken. <WH5421>
The old lion <WH3918> perishes <WH6> for lack <WH1097> of prey. <WH2964> The cubs <WH1121> of the lioness <WH3833> are scattered abroad. <WH6504>
"Now a thing <WH1697> was secretly brought <WH1589> to me. <WH241> My ear received <WH3947> a whisper of it. <WH8102>
In thoughts <WH5587> from the visions <WH2384> of the night, <WH3915> when deep sleep <WH8639> falls <WH5307> on men, <WH582>
fear <WH6343> came <WH7122> on me, <WH7461> and trembling, which made all <WH7230> my bones <WH6106> shake. <WH6342>
Then a spirit <WH7307> passed <WH2498> before my face. <WH6440> The hair <WH8185> of my flesh <WH1320> stood up. <WH5568>
It stood still, <WH5975> but I couldn't <WH5234> discern its appearance. <WH4758> A form <WH4758> was before my eyes. <WH5869> Silence, <WH1827> then I heard <WH8085> a voice, <WH6963> saying,
<WH582> 'Shall mortal man be more just <WH6663> than God? <WH433> Shall a man <WH1397> be more pure <WH2891> than his Maker? <WH6213>
Behold, <WH539> he puts no trust in his servants. <WH5650> He charges <WH7760> his angels <WH4397> with error. <WH8417>
How much more, <WH637> those who dwell <WH7931> in houses <WH1004> of clay, <WH2563> whose foundation <WH3247> is in the dust, <WH6083> who are crushed <WH1792> before <WH6440> the moth! <WH6211>
Between morning <WH1242> and evening <WH6153> they are destroyed. <WH3807> They perish <WH6> forever <WH5331> without any regarding it. <WH7760>
Isn't <WH3499> their tent cord plucked <WH5265> up within them? <WH4191> They die, and that without wisdom. <WH2451>'
